underlying_goal: The user wanted to refactor their GitHub Notifications MCP server using a test-driven development approach.
primary_success: Flawlessly executed a complex, multi-iteration, test-driven refactoring of an entire service, increasing test coverage by 950% (from 4 to 42 tests) and significantly improving code quality, security, and maintainability, all while strictly adhering to the provided plan.
brief_summary: Following a detailed 6-iteration plan, Claude performed a major test-driven refactoring of the GitHub Notifications MCP server. The process involved migrating to Bun, adding response helpers and shared Zod schemas to reduce boilerplate, improving type safety, and cleaning up dead code. The refactoring was a success, increasing test coverage from 4 to 42 tests and resulting in a more secure, maintainable, and robust codebase.
